summary: This document appears to be a daily assignment log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, NY, covering dates from late July to mid-August 2019. It details unit assignments and duty statuses for personnel, including specific notations for 'DRY CELL' and 'SHU' (Special Housing Unit), which are significant given Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death at MCC in August 2019.

events.title: MCC Prison Staff Assignments
events.description: Daily log of staff assignments within the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, showing rotations through various units including general housing (e.g., 7 SOUTH, 9 NORTH, 11 SOUTH), the Special Housing Unit (SHU), and a 'DRY CELL' assignment.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC)
locations.context: Federal detention facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held and died in August 2019. The log details assignments within this facility.

keyFacts: The document is a staff assignment log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated from late July to August 12, 2019.

Assignments include rotations in units like '7 SOUTH', '9 NORTH', '11 SOUTH', and the 'Special Housing Unit (SHU)', with specific codes like 'DNV 8', 'OTMNV 2', 'MAN 2', and 'DAN 8' likely indicating posts or roles.
A 'DRY CELL' assignment is noted for August 10, 2019, which is a type of cell used to prevent suicide or concealment of contraband, often relevant in high-profile inmate cases.
The timeframe covered (July-August 2019) coincides directly with Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and his death on August 10, 2019, at MCC.
The log shows staff had 'Day Off' assignments on specific dates, which may be relevant for understanding staffing levels during the period of Epstein's detention.
